cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 450 miles southwest of Tampa Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating north-northeastward toward the Florida Big Bend, then expected to cross northern Florida and move offshore into the western Atlantic toward the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near or just north of Cedar Key)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Altamaha Sound GA to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Indian Pass FL to Englewood FL, and Altamaha Sound GA to Sebastian Inlet FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast from Englewood through Tampa Bay to the Big Bend, then Atlantic coasts of GA and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Sustained 35–45 mph with occasional gusts 50 mph possible Monday afternoon into Monday night
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft water rise possible in and around Tampa Bay, highest at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated totals up to 8 inches Monday–Tuesday, producing localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, minor coastal flooding, and isolated tornadoes Monday
